reviewText: Who put this together?  Oh, this is just terrible. You'd think that on the cutting floor they'd look at these low quality films and just trash them before they are released.  I love good Christian films and this is not one.  As it ended, our whole family just balked, and the kids we're like "Are you kidding me? This was horrible."  The music is awkward, the acting is just BAD, and the story line is so weak.  Make sure that if you have to watch it, that you rent it.  And please, don't give this as a gift, it's just an embarrassment to the Christian film industry.  I trusted this as a Dove award winner and should have read up on it more.  It is  not a good family film.  If you want a better film, move over to Hidden Secrets, or To Save A Life they are much better than this.  I usually don't write ratings but just had to on this one.  And by the way, I did buy this, all 14 bucks worth.  It did however move through the shredder just fine with no problems at all.
summary: Oh No, Another B Christian film....Ugh.
Title: Crossroad

reviewText: Written, directed and edited by Youssefian this is a character interaction screenplay. It's low-budget...the entire thing takes place in a café! These are relatively difficult to write correctly. To make it work, the writer does use contrived license in that the seven or so primary actors all have links to someone else in the group. It is written backwards, so that these commonalities are slowly revealed as the screenplay moves forward. The storyline could have been adequate without the 'God thing' and this may put a lot of people who don't like propaganda off from watching it. If you can ignore that, it is a good study in what actors can do with little action, blowing stuff up or rolling over cars. The idea is to surprise the viewer as realizations are slowly revealed and the writer is successful in doing this. Editing is tight and contributes to proper interaction. Everything matters in viewing this, so you can't do your taxes or be distracted during the viewing. See it to see what neighborhood theater is like and what really can be done when all the movie-making elements come together!
Title: Crossroad

reviewText: It was a real surprise to see how all the lives of the people in the diner were intertwined in one way or another. How they were brought together for a reason at a specific time and place. Kept us wondering how it was going to end. Great movie involving Faith,Love and forgiveness.
Title: Crossroad

reviewText: A robbery gone bad and things/people aren't what they seem. Was I entertained, YES, was the storyline plausable, YES, will I watch it again, MORE THAN LIKELY. It's nice to know that there are people out there that can make a decent movie without a multimillion dollar star studded cast and a $100M of GCI effects.
Title: Crossroad

reviewText: Into this fifteen minutes and I immediately had the sense this is an amateurish made production. I don't mean it looks bad. Not at all. It's just that I didn't believe the actors! No charisma at all. There's  tension but it's contrived. The entire fifteen minutes felt CONTRIVED. I had no desire to continue watching.Perhaps with  talented actors, this might be a better movie??? Maybe.
Title: Crossroad

reviewText: I love Christian movies but this one was a weird one.  Lots of deep issues and I would NOT call this a family film.  It was interesting and they certainly talked about God but it was just weird.
Title: Crossroad
